title: Children's Charity newsletter with Helvetica Rounded Bold
content:
I’m designing a newsletter for a children’s charity that uses Helvetica Rounded Bold in their logo. I’m looking for another face to use for headlines, and a serif for the body copy.

Any suggestions?

Also, is there a lightweight version of Helvetica Rounded, or another face in a lightweight I could use with it?

Thanks

 [‹ Agriculture Management Logo Ideas anyone?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112341/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38697 "Go to previous forum topic") [Case-sensitive punctuation in Spanish ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112341/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38693 "Go to next forum topic")
author: altoption

comments.content: Have a look at [FF Speak](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112341/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_speak_ot/). It’s very friendly and works well at large sizes.

For body copy, it might be nice to recall the traditional “schoolbook” type of vintage children’s books:

[Plantin Schoolbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112341/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/plantin_schoolbook/)  
 [ParaType Schoolbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112341/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/paratype/schoolbook_ot/)  
 [Century Schoolbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112341/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/bitstream/century_schoolbook_ot/)  
 [Bembo Schoolbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102112341/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/bembo_schoolbook/) - a bit more formal
Thanks, Stephen. I love the conceptual approach. Thanks for pointing me in that direction.
